import numpy as np # linear algebra

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

source.4fe88b35: sal.info() #displays information regarding the data within the columns
source.97d1a133: sal['TotalPay'].describe() #outputs statistical information for the 'TotalPay' column
source.b773bfdb: sal[sal['TotalPayBenefits']==sal['TotalPayBenefits'].min()] #information about the lowest paid employee (the one with negative pay!)
source.12203852: sal.groupby('Year')['TotalPay'].mean() #mean value of the TotalPay by year
source.eeb128f8: sal['JobTitle'].value_counts().head() #top 5 most common job titles and how many people have said titles
source.c1251629: sum(sal[sal['Year']==2013]['JobTitle'].value_counts()==1) #number of job titles represented by one person only in 2013
source.933490c3: sum(sal['JobTitle'].apply(lambda x: 'chief' in x.lower().split())) #number of people that have the word 'chief' in their job title
source.8fc6d562: sal['title_len'] = sal['JobTitle'].apply(len) #creates new column with the length of the job title
source.f19c4e19: There does not seem to be any correlation between the total pay including benefits and the length of the job title.
source.679a20ca: It can be seen that the mean value of the TotalPay is 74768 USD, with a maximum of 567595 USD and a minimum of -618 USD. The minimum may suggest that the employee had lost money to the business, or been fined for some misconduct.
